channel.title: Help Please?
channel.description:
Hey guys I am new to the whole coding thing but willing to learn and this is probably the easiest problem to solve but i have no idea :palm: help will be much appreciated.
[u][b]When I attempt to run my SOURCE I get this.[/b][/u] Loading Up Files... javac: invalid flag: -Xmx1300m Usage: javac <options> <source files> use -help for a list of possible options Press any key to continue . . . [hr] [u][b]When I attempt to run the CLIENT I get this.[/b][/u] javac: invalid flag: -Xmx512m Usage: javac <options> <source files> use -help for a list of possible options Press any key to continue . . .
As I said I am new to this whole thing so go easy on me guys. :)

item.title: Help Please?
item.dc:creator: @xii-santa xii-santa
item.description:
@xii-santa wrote:

[quote=“Docent, post:2, topic:535893”]Uhh. remove the Xmx1300m and the -Xmx512m because you’re not supposed to allocate memory to compile a bloody program. OR if you’re trying to run them, change the “javac” to “java”[/quote]I did this and it worked, thanks.

Read full topic

item.title: Help Please?
item.dc:creator: @Docent Limits
item.description:
@Docent wrote:

Uhh. remove the Xmx1300m and the -Xmx512m because you’re not supposed to allocate memory to compile a bloody program. OR if you’re trying to run them, change the “javac” to “java”

Read full topic

item.title: Help Please?
item.dc:creator: @xii-santa xii-santa
item.description:
@xii-santa wrote:

Hey guys I am new to the whole coding thing but willing to learn and this is probably the easiest problem to solve but i have no idea :palm: help will be much appreciated.

When I attempt to run my SOURCE I get this.
Loading Up Files…
javac: invalid flag: -Xmx1300m
Usage: javac
use -help for a list of possible options
Press any key to continue . . .
[hr]
When I attempt to run the CLIENT I get this.
javac: invalid flag: -Xmx512m
Usage: javac
use -help for a list of possible options
Press any key to continue . . .

As I said I am new to this whole thing so go easy on me guys.

Read full topic
